boardgame.name: Super Mario Blow Up! Shaky Tower Balancing Game
boardgame.description: In the center of a the tower is an off-balance ball resting delicately on a tiny platform. Players roll a die to determine how many Super Mario figurines they need to add/remove from the balancing boards on the edge of the tower. If the tower leans to far, the ball will thunder down the center of the tower and knock all the figurines off their balancing boards. The player who does this loses the game.

boardgame.name: Valls 1809: Batalla del puente de Goi
boardgame.description:
Valls 1809 is a Napoleonic game from the Spanish War of Independence. A battle in which Saint Cyr, commanding the French army, wants to finish off the Spanish army under Reding before sunset. Time is key for the Napoleonic side while the ally must defend itself until night falls.

A simple block game for two with a solitaire option.

With 5 minutes of explanation, it allows a dynamic game with several decisions that can be key to victory in approximately 15 - 20 minutes. It can be played with the basic module, but by adding the tactical cards, they give greater historical flavor and variety in the decisions of the players. Playing with events (optional) allow replayability in different hypothetical scenarios.

Will the Spanish army hold out until nightfall or will the potential of the French army be unrivaled?

boardgame.name: Lasso
boardgame.description:
A deceptively simple tile placement and enclosure game, Lasso pits two players against each other to rotate, flip, and exchange hexagonal tiles to be the first player to create a full contiguous loop around the center cow tile.

There are at least one of the two patterned ropes on every tile in play, striped and solid. There are special tiles with two of one pattern, or a "wild" rope that can be used by either player. On your turn, you may do one of the following: A) rotate a tile in its current position B) exchange two tiles in the play area without changing their orientation or C) exchanging a tile in the play area with the single tile you have in your hand. You may not take an action to simply reverse the other player's previous turn.

Weigh the odds of every tile you place and keep track of all of your possible lassos while looking out for your opponent's lasso. Be the first to round up that cattle before the other wrangler! Giddy up!

boardgame.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Definitive Edition – Rook City Renegades: Foil Promo Pack 2
boardgame.description: Foil card versions of each hero character card, each villain character card, and each event card from the Rook City Renegades expansion.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Definitive Edition
Sentinels of the Multiverse: Definitive Edition – Rook City Renegades

boardgame.name: Ridley's Games Room: Pub Quiz
boardgame.description:
Points are scored by answering quiz questions correctly. To win the trophy you need to be in the team with more points at the end of the game.
Each team should take a pencil, a chance chip and a joker chip.
There are 200 Quiz question cards (1000 questions in total) divided in ten categories.
For a quick game select 10 question cards, one for category.
For a full-length fame select 20 question cards, two for category.
The Question Master reads questions and each team write their answers on their answer sheets.
Additionally once per game, per team a joker chip or a chance chip can be played (not in the same round).
With joker chip: each correct answer of that team in this round counts double, but each wrong answer counts a -1 point.
Chance chip: When a question is read, a team can pass for it and get one point without answering, by spending the chance chip instead.
The team with more points at the end wins.

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Legion – Grand Master Yoda Commander Expansion
boardgame.description: Bring one of the most iconic Jedi to your Republic armies with the Grand Master Yoda Commander Expansion for Star Wars: Legion! Yoda has trained generations of Jedi Knights and he brings his skills both as a mentor and with a lightsaber to your armies. Whether he is aiding friendly units or using his mastery of the Ataru form of lightsaber combat, Yoda adds a powerful new option to the Republic’s ranks. This expansion adds this legendary Jedi to your Star Wars: Legion collection, beginning with two beautifully detailed, unpainted Grand Master Yoda miniatures that can be assembled in a variety of poses, such as leaping into battle or concentrating while reaching out with the Force. All of Yoda’s skills, including his deep connection to the Force, are laid out on a unit card and his three signature command cards. These substantial powers can be further augmented by eight upgrade cards that grant him new Force powers and ways to command your armies. Finally, this expansion also includes a Republic unit card and an additional command card for the mighty Wookiee Chewbacca, allowing you to use your existing miniature in this faction.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Toongeon Fights
boardgame.description: Toongeon Fights is a cooperative toongeon crawling deck-building game for 1 to 4 players, on which you will have to explore encounter cards in order to fight monsters, get around trap rooms, pick up treasures, solve event cards and finally defeat one of the six monster bosses to claim the great treasure of the Toongeon and win the game!

boardgame.name: Post Mortem LA: Lights... Camera... Murder!
boardgame.description:
Lights, Camera, Murder! is a Narrative mystery game inspired by SHCD.

Set in 1940’s Los Angeles, you will take on the role of probationary cautionary auxiliary investigator at the Global Detective Agency and assist them on the case. All the files you need will be sent to your door, including a map of your jurisdiction and pertinent evidence. It will be yours to investigate, follow leads, interrogate suspects, study the clues, and solve the murder. Once you think you have the answers, you can write them on the Final Report included in the box, then break the seal to read the resolution and find out if you were successful in your investigation.

The case centers around the murder of movie-star Clara Rose and her estranged husband Joe Fletcher. They were found shot to death on the dusty backlot of Orpheum Pictures. Classic murder-suicide? Hollywood rivalries that became too real? Mob debts unpaid? Or perhaps something far more sinister... As the Global Detective Agency’s newest recruit, it is up to you to find the truth.

boardgame.name: Wer sagt zuerst "Hundert"?
boardgame.description:
The players take turns to roll and move. For their next move the players perform the mathematical operation printed on the space they are standing on with the result of the die roll to determine to which space they have to move. The first player to reach space 100 wins the game.

The game was published as a supplement to the children's book "Die Perle der grünen Nixe"

boardgame.name: Der sichere Weg
boardgame.description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On the roll of a 6 they start at the Kindergarten, School, Shopping Mall or House Nr. 12 and have to reach the location in the opposite corner of the game map, while minding the traffic rules.

The players have to stop on the red and yellow spaces. To move from a yellow space the player needs to roll an even number, to move from a red space a 6 is needed.

If the player wants to use the tram, he has to wait on the blue spaces till he rolls an odd number. Additionally he loses 3 turns while riding the tram. On the fourth turn he arrives at his destination stop and continues on foot.

The first player to reach his destination location wins the game.

The game was published as a cardboard assembly kit.

boardgame.name: Play the Ball Australian Football
boardgame.description:
Play the Ball is based on the popular sport of Australian Rules Football. The game has two opposing teams that move a disc (the ball) up and down a numbered path on a rectangular board using a teetotum.

A player may land on a favorable spot such as "Mark" or "Play On" and get another spin. The player may also land on a penalty spot and turn the ball over to the opposing team. The opposing team then moves the ball to the opposite position and has a spin.

Teams score points by advancing the ball along their side until they reach spot 17 or 21 and receive 6 points (a goal) or 16 or 20 for one point.

Play time is agreed by players at the beginning of the game and the team with the highest tallied score at the end of time is the winner
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: The Valentine Publishing Co. Pty. Ltd.

boardgame.name: Das Dan Cooper-Weltraumspiel
boardgame.description:
Each player chooses one of four planets for his base. They get a spaceship and 7 conquest marker. The players take turns spinning the spinner and moving the spaceships accordingly. On unoccupied planets conquest markers are placed.

On planets marked with a red number, the players have to draw an action card and follow the instructions printed thereon.

If the spinner shows a robot, the player may place a robot on an unconquered planet, which now is reserved for later conquest.

If the spinner shows a monster, the player may conquer an already conquered planet for himself.

The game ends when all planets are conquered or an agreed on time limit has passed. The players add the numbers on their conquered planets and the player with the highest result wins the game.

The game was published in the comic magazines "Zack" Nr. 21 and 22 (1980).

boardgame.name: トリック・オア・トリート (Trick or Treat)
boardgame.description:
トリック・オア・トリート (Trick or Treat) is a card game from Japan. It uses a rock-paper-scissors mechanism to collect chocolate or sweets whilst going Trick Or Treat.

Players have three cards in hand, Trick, Candy, Chocolate, and choose one to place face-down. When all players have chosen, the cards are turned up and resolved.

If a majority have chosen candy or chocolate, then cards are collected from the sweets deck. But if a trick card is in play, that player can take cards from the others. The different majorities are resolved in different ways.

There is a deck of sweets shuffled and placed face-down. Depending on who won the round, cards are turned face-up and collected from the deck. these cards include candy, chocolate and ghosts. Players are trying to collect sets of candy or chocolate to win.

If a ghost turns up, it is set aside but the payer gets to steal cards from their neighbour.
user summary

boardgame.name: Blow it Up!
boardgame.description:
Greedy miner dwarves are in a diamond mine, each with a dynamite and some matchsticks. Any one of them tries to collect more gems and in this way, they do anything; even stealing gems from others. Time is passing and the fuses are getting shorter and shorter. Whose dynamite will explode? Whose gems will survive? Who is the winner of this greedy game?

The game is played over several turns. Each player in their turn, roll all 6 dice. Then must choose to keep or re-roll some or all of them up to two times. Then they must resolve the dice results. Depending on what are the results, the player may: turn on the fuse of other players’ dynamite; turn his/her dynamite off; pick some gem tokens from the bag; steal some gem tokens from other players; and save some of his/her gems.

Any "Sand glass" die rolled, cannot be re-rolled. For each sand glass die rolled, one “sand” marker is moved from the upper bulb to the lower one to resemble the passage of time. Whenever the upper bulb runs out of sand, one of the central pieces of each dynamite which has burning fuse is removed.

When only one player (or no player) has unexploded dynamite left, the game ends. Then all players flip over their gem tokens and the player with the most gems is the winner.

boardgame.name: Tribal
boardgame.description:
Tribal is inspired by Patience, but it's not a solo game! Observation and strategy are key elements.
Follow the wise African's advice: "Ask your ennemi for advice and do the opposite! "

Just like Patience, make cards piles by alternating colors to complete your sacred piles (from 1 to 9). You play with your cards as well as with your opponent's: steal theirs or give them some to take the advantage and slow them down.

The first one to complete their 4 sacred piles wins the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

This game is very similar to what is called "Zankpatiencen" (quarrel patiences) in German Patience rulebooks or to Russian Bank.

boardgame.name: Distant Worlds 2
boardgame.description:
Distant Worlds 2 is a vast, pausable real-time 4X space strategy game. Experience the full depth and detail of turn-based strategy, but with the simplicity and ease of real-time, and on the scale of a massively-multiplayer online game. The Universe is Yours!

THE GALAXY LIVES ON

Huge Galaxies with up to 2,000 star systems and tens of thousands of planets, moons and asteroids are yours to explore and exploit, whether peacefully through mining and diplomacy or by conquest! The complex process of generating a galaxy ensures that every new game will be different and the many galaxy setup options ensure incredible replayability as well as the ability to have your game be just the way you like it.

CHOOSE YOUR SIDE

Galaxies are so deep, fun and immersive that you won’t want to finish the game. Choose from seven playable base game factions which cover a wide variety of playstyles. Build, expand and improve your empire while playing through the storylines, with victory conditions or in an open-ended sandbox mode. Each galaxy is packed with life and activity. Encounter other empires, independent alien colonies, traders, pirates and space monsters. Explore star systems, asteroid fields, galactic storms and black holes. Discover evidence of civilizations long since past, uncovering secrets about the galaxy's troubled history...

CHOOSE YOUR SIDE

Intelligent automation allows you to tailor the game to your preferred playstyle and scale. Decide how much you want to control and which gameplay areas suit you best. You can limit your focus to just one ship or expand it all the way up to everything in a vast galactic empire. Let your advisors and the intelligent automation handle the rest!

BUILD YOUR OWN

A Built-in Game Editor allows you to fine-tune your own galaxy, adding or removing star systems, planets, asteroids, ships, star bases, space monsters or anything else. Modify the attributes of any empire in your game for the ultimate custom experience.

Extensive In-Game Help is included. Exhaustive, built-in, context-sensitive help is always only a single key-press away. Press F1 at any time for a detailed explanation of the current game screen, your currently selected item, and so on, or just browse the complete “Galactopedia”
Tutorials are included to quickly familiarize you with all of the game elements and tools.

Best of all, these all combine to let you play the game your way: enjoy a quick, intense game in a crowded sector of space or take your time in an epic game spread across a vast galaxy! (Source: Slitherine game page.)

boardgame.name: Ka Pai: Roto Waho
boardgame.description: Variant of Ka Pai released during quarantine, where the result of both dice is used on separate sides of the field.

boardgame.name: ガニメデ戦記Zero (The War Chronicles of Ganymede Zero)
boardgame.description:
ガニメデ戦記Zero (The War Chronicles of Ganymede Zero) is a two player card game from Japan in which Mechs are enhanced with transparent cards.

The battle for new resources discovered on Jupiter's moon Ganymede was fierce: in 208X the battle using humanoid weapons called Mechs began in earnest, and Mechs with various equipment appeared on the scene.

The game is a card game in which players use transparent cards to equip three Mechs and fight battles with the equipped Mechs; each Mech can be equipped with three different types of equipment: right hand, left hand and back.

Who will be the first to defeat the opposing unit?
user summary

The publisher says:
In the year 208X, over the resources discovered on Jupiter, a war broke out between the Nyekundu force and the Vert force.
On the satellite Ganymede, the foothold for mining the resources on Jupiter, humanoid battle weapons called Mechs were engaged in battles.

In this game, players, each as the captain of a platoon, aim to destroy the enemy force.
The player who destroys all three Mechs of their opponent wins.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: さとーふぁみりあ (Sato Familie)

boardgame.name: Tidal Terror Tower
boardgame.description:
An entry in the Tenfootpole WaveStone Keep adventure design contest!

From the publishers blurb:

A fearsome tower of stone prowls the salt-drenched coast! It appears at dusk to disgorge hundreds of rapacious lizardmen who carry off treasure and captives never to be seen again. By dawn, the tower is gone. Deliver the coastline from the terror of the tower! Earn a barony through your bravery or see the coast descend into poverty and piracy because of your failure!

boardgame.name: Mantis Maiden
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to issue 4 of Instant Villain!

This PDF contains a full write-up of Mantis Maiden.

Each issue of Instant Villain: Includes full stats, background story, support cast write-up, tactical and plot suggestions.

boardgame.name: Wie ben ik?: Het spel
boardgame.description: A party game to guess who, what and where you are. A spinning wheel decides what type of question you can ask. Played with three different categories, who first has unraveled their card in each of the three categories wins the game.

boardgame.name: Land of the Rising Sun Folklore Bestiary
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

For centuries, the Japanese have called their islands the Land of the Rising Sun. Set in Feudal Age Japan, this sourcebook for 5th edition of Chivalry & Sorcery features a Bestiary drawn from the folklore of the Japan of legend. Within these pages you will find details of more than a hundred yokai, or creatures from Japanese folklore, along with game stats for Land of the Rising Sun.

This is more than just another book of monsters to kill, though. Like all creatures from folklore, wherever they may come from, each entity in this book has its own story, its own cultural significance, and its own particular challenges. Some may be overcome by force, but others require a more thoughtful approach. Some are linked to Japanese social mores and attitudes, and others to Buddhist or Shinto theology.

boardgame.name: Marvel: Rock Paper Heroes – Enter the Danger Room
boardgame.description:
Rock Paper Heroes: Enter the Danger Room is a fast and frantic reimagining of the classic game of throwing hand gestures. Now, these gestures represent the powerful mutant abilities of eight iconic heroes who are training to become protectors of mutantkind!

Whether you want to use a mastery of the weather like Storm, cosmic-fire like Phoenix, or you're simply the best at what you do like Wolverine, get ready for some fun in the Danger Room that can't be missed! The hero that makes the best use of their powers and has uncanny reactions to the situation they're in will win.
boardgame.commerceweblink: Geek Game Shop listing for Marvel Rock Paper Hero: Enter The Danger Room
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Shotglass Rounds Volume 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

10 One-Shots. Are YOU ready to load up?

SHOTGLASS ROUNDS Volume 1 is a collection of the first 10 adventures in the Shotglass Rounds series. These One-Shots for 5e & OSR are for the DM who doesn’t like to prep! Flexible, convenient, super-charged excitement in a compact package that won’t have you sitting up for hours doing prep for your next game session! Each adventure is designed for a 4-5 hour game and includes 2 new monsters, 2 new magic items, a full-size player’s map with grid & a full-size grid-less player’s map!

10 Rounds of Adventure, 21 new monsters, 22 new magic items. Load up and fire away.

boardgame.name: Speak with Animals: Animal Companions I (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Speak with Animals: Animal Companions I adds 12 new animal stat blocks and easy-to-use companion stat blocks for use with the 5th edition of the well known roleplaying system including the dire corgi, giant hamster, fossa and hyaenodon.

boardgame.name: The Juggernaut
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Prestige Class for 5E from the Realm Scribe!

Becoming a juggernaut requires one thing above all; strength. Juggernauts are capable of wielding weapons in ways that others can scarcely imagine, leveraging their great strength into presice strikes. They can wield two-handed weapons in each hand, throw weapons with force enough to shatter targets, and stop mighty beasts in their tracks with a single spear thrust. As you progress further into this prestige class you learn to deal the deadliest of strikes, make weapon attacks hit critical points, and become as strong as the mightiest of giants.

This class is for high-level campaigns that allow for multi-classing in order for a character to meet the requirements for this Prestige Class. It is designed to fuse together the concepts of the raging barbarian and trained fighter, and requires great strength, levels in both the barbarian and fighter classes, and to be at least 10th level before taking a level in this class. Prestige Classes are very powerful and meant for high threat campaigns.

boardgame.name: Paths of Iron
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Paths of Iron introduces a set of expert and master paths that focus on iron and steel. The bulwark masters forging armor and bestowing on it special properties, while the fae scourge seizes upon faeries’ innate aversion to the metal and develops combat techniques to exploit iron’s influence on them. With the options presented in this supplement, your character can take the steps along the iron road.

boardgame.name: Legendary Inquisitors
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unexpectedly Awesome!

Legendary Inquisitors is the latest volume in our series of player-focused supplements, offering unorthodox options for the sternest of spellcasters! Enforcers of the church, Inquisitors are divine agents acting as judge, jury, and executioner in fantasy settings where multiple gods and religious factions struggle for power. Already established as one of the coolest classes in the game, this new supplement offers even more ways for the Inquisitor to execute their grim duties. In this book, we offer an abundant variety of new options to customize your character for the role they must fulfil. With inspiration drawn from history, fantasy, and etymology, these new options include: 8 Inquisitorial Offices (powerful alternatives to Judgment), 5 inquisitions, 26 archetypes, 11 feats, 6 spells, mythic rules, the Inquisitor cleric doctrine for Pathfinder 2E, as well as a wide assortment of other options that thematically and mechanically cover your righteous roleplaying needs.

boardgame.name: ツクローマ (Tsukuroma)
boardgame.description:
ツクローマ (Tsukuroma) is a card game from Japan. Players are trying to build the highest rank of three cards using only the Roman numerals I, V and X. But each card they discard has an effect which is applied at discard.

The game has only 16 cards; 8 I Cards, 5 V and 3 X cards. The deck is shuffled, payers are dealt three hand cards and the remainder go as a draw pile. On a player's turn, they draw one card and either place one card in front of themselves or discard one card. each card has a special effect, and the one they discard is applied immediately.

The game ends when the deck is exhausted. the player who built the highest combo, from III to XXX, is the winner.
user summary

boardgame.name: Wiseguys: Floodlines
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Wiseguys Tale

"Loony" John's wife and daughter are fleeing, she has had enough of his abuse and looking for a way out. The crew has been ordered to find them at any cost. Unfortunately, a rival capo is also looking for them, they will make wonderful bargaining chips.

Emotions are high and the heat is not helping. People are going to get hurt.

And in the background, the radio weatherman warns of a massive storm on the way...

boardgame.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught
boardgame.description:
Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught is a competitive skirmish game in which each player controls an adventuring party from one of the powerful factions of the Forgotten Realms. Parties delve into dungeons, battle rival adventurers, and confront fearsome monsters on a quest for treasure and glory.

In more detail, Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught is a scenario-based combat game in which you collect treasure, level up, and bring powerful abilities to bear using dice rolls, upgrade cards, and the new combat dial card system to keep track of the action.

The core set of Onslaught includes material for two players, including twelve characters from two factions (Harpers and Zhentarim) and a horde of monsters — 21 pre-painted figures in all.
