Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Battletech: Spotlight on Manyfold Paths
boardgame.description:
Few Com Guard commands claim a more storied history than the Manyfold Paths. History remembers them fighting the Jade Falcons to great effect on Tukayyid and elsewhere. They also took the fight to the Word of Blake in the Chaos March. Later, they fought in the Great Refusal before the formation met its final end on Terra during Case White. Today the Manyfold Paths legacy continues in both spirit and will in the White Lions mercenary company, commanded by Seth Nicholson, a direct descendant of one of Manyfold Paths’ commanders. The White Lions made a name for themselves fighting Malvina Hazen’s Jade Falcons.

Spotlight On: Manyfold Paths includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: たった今考えたプロポーズの言葉を君に捧ぐよ。 ミニ拡張セット ─トニカクカワイイ─ (Instant Propose: Tonikaku Kawaii)
boardgame.description:
たった今考えたプロポーズの言葉を君に捧ぐよ。 ミニ拡張セット ─トニカクカワイイ─ (Instant Propose: Tonikaku Kawaii) is an expansion pack for the game Instant Propose (たった今考えたプロポーズの言葉を君に捧ぐよ。). It adds 24 new cards to the base game. The pack is themed on a popular romantic manga called Fly Me To The Moon.
user summary
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Instant Propose (たった今考えたプロポーズの言葉を君に捧ぐよ。)

boardgame.name: Almost Innocent
boardgame.description:
Almost Innocent is a cooperative deduction game with a progressive story where your teammates must work together across different scenarios to prove your innocence.

Each player will be responsible for the solution of another player. Turn after turn each player will ask select questions that will not only help them but everyone else playing as well. The goal is to find out who did it, with what weapon and where before the time runs out!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Mechanism: Give a Clue / Get a Clue

boardgame.name: Palace on the Pink Waves
boardgame.description:
An Entry in the Tenfootpole Washstone Keep adventure design contest!

From the publishers blurb:

Lament the Wine Sea, with its pitiless tides and fearsome depths! Forlorn castaways are drawn to a lonesome island where lords and beggars alike scrounge to make the most of their terrible, drunken fate.

A whimsical, nautical, drunken adventure for the Cairn system.

boardgame.name: Retribution (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 5e-compatible adventure for four 1st-level PCs by Creighton Broadhurst

This expanded, reorganised edition of Retribution features new art and new text.

In the frozen depths of winter, murderous winds mercilessly batter the crumbling Priory of Cymer. Within, trapped by their duty and the heaped snowdrifts that render travel near impossible, the few remaining faithful huddle together and tend the sacred places of their forbears. With the weather worsening, nerves fray and tempers snap as the wind howls its mournful dirge for the forgotten dead of a fallen time. But the worst is yet to come. One of those trapped within holds a murderous grudge that only blood can expunge and as the storm reaches its savage height terrible revenge is wrought amid the frigid halls and faded glories of a bygone age.

boardgame.name: Nur der Tod träumt nicht
boardgame.description:
You and three friends slip into the roles of the four characters for one evening, solve the tricky puzzles together, find the culprit among yourselves, solve the murder and spend an exciting and fun evening with "Nur der Tod träumt nicht" ("Only Death Doesn't Dream").

Drenched in sweat, you wake up, having been rudely awakened. You are a participant of an experiment about dreams with Prof. Dromen. Last night you went to bed under his care in the sleep laboratory together with other test persons. That same night, Prof. Dromen was murdered in the diagnostic room. Did someone have a score to settle with him? Does the murder have something to do with the experiment? Or is it all just a bad dream? Uncover the secrets of the other players and find the murderer.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Satchel Quest
boardgame.description:
Satchel Quest is a rogue-like bag-building puzzle game where players take on the role of dungeon-crawling adventurers, trying to make it the furthest into the dungeon to claim the most valor! Players will build a satchel of weapons, spells, items, traps, monsters, and loot - creating synergistic combinations in order to be victorious! Players also gain power-ups that let them manipulate their bags and the dungeon, and mitigate the luck-of-the-draw!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Orange Swan: UberTex Map
boardgame.description:
"Uber Tex" game map for Orange Swan.

Printed on a high quality waterproof PPE canvas, the ORANGE SWAN UberTex Map is 44% larger than the one included in the Game Box.

145 cm x 103 cm, rolled

boardgame.name: Dwellings of Eldervale: Shapeshifter
boardgame.description:
Eldervale is a land of opportunity and rumors abound with skillful Mercenaries willing to fight for any side willing to pay. Mercenaries are optional Units (not Monsters) that may each be included separately at the beginning of any game.

To include a Mercenary, simply place the miniature of standee and corresponding Mercenary card in a central area that all players can see and reach at the start of the game.

As a Free Action on your turn, using either Gold or an Orb, you may hire a Mercenary. The hired Mercenary is placed directly into your Ready Area and is available for use. If you paid Gold to hire the Mercenary, it will be yours until the end of your next Regroup action. If you hired the Mercenary using an Orb, it is yours for the rest of the game.

The Shapeshifter Miniature is a new mercenary class for Dwellings of Eldervale that comes in its own tuckbox - separate from any version of Dwellings of Eldervale. Included in the tuck box is the 50mm Minotaur miniature, standee, and corresponding game card. For the right price you can hire the Shapeshifter, a very versatile ally. The Mimic ability allows you to use one of your other Unit's abilities, except Build.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Lunar Signal Lost
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the Lunar Research 1 facility suddenly goes dark out in the void of the astral plane, the automated failsafe sends out a distress beacon with a final plea for help - travel to the facility and purge it before the contamination spreads beyond their walls. Will you brave the arcane research facility on the edge of the outer planes in Lunar Signal Lost?

Lunar Signal Lost is a Fifth Edition adventure designed for four to six characters of 7th to 11th level and is optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 9.

This adventure contains 4 new monsters, a custom battlemap, 3 new magic items and 2 musical tracks to bring your session to life!

boardgame.name: Dragon+ (Issue 41 - Mar 2022)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Come for the exclusives, stay for the downloadable maps, art, and quests! Ajit George offers a first look at Journeys Through the Radiant Citadel, while Call of the Netherdeep shares unseen concept art.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Beadle & Grimm's Silver Edition of Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
The Best of the Dungeon Masters Guild
Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep
Trick or Treat Studios D&D Masks

boardgame.name: Clash of Decks: The Ukrainian
boardgame.description:
The Ukrainian is a promo champion that was created during the Russian/Ukrainian War. It was offered in a pay what you want model that provided anybody willing to donate a copy of the Starter Kit and the exclusive Champion Card.

The card needs a starter kit to be playable, and has 1 attack and 4 defence.

The special abilities are:
Protection
Indestructible
Defender

boardgame.name: Welcome to Kyodaina
boardgame.description:
From Patreon:

Your adventures have been fruitful, you have pushed the frontiers of the Known Roomlands beyond anything any generation of explorers before you ever has... and now you've found something new. Something astonishing.

The Roomlands of Kyodaina are a whole new land. It's still the Colostle, but it looks quite different. After all, there isn't just one type of castle!

This module is just the first in a whole chapter describing the new lands of Kyodaina. There will be much more to come such as new encounter tables, new battle rules for the new Kyodainan Rooks, and a new story campaign that will have you go on a much larger scale adventure through these new lands and uncover a strange mystery that will expose more lore of the world.

boardgame.name: Dark Files: 01-KOMA
boardgame.description:
Dark Files: 01-KOMA is a multimedia detective game experience in a realistic criminal case.

Detectives work together to solve a case with the help of the information provided in different ways: Some information is provided by the printed media within the game (like newspapers, photos, business cards, letters etc.), another part of the information is provided digitally (on websites, by phone calls or SMS). Therefore the following tools are necessary to play the game: mobile phone and internet browser.

What happened to Ben? - You find your friend Ben (39) knocked out and unconscious in his kitchen. After taking the necessary steps to help him, you wonder what could have happened. As a friend and close confidant, you dive into Ben's life and try to find out with your mutual acquaintance Larissa why Ben fell victim to this crime. And what does his current case have to do with it?
A gripping and multidimensional TRUE CRIME detective game experience.

Koma is the 1st case of the dark files detective game series. Each case is self-contained. Dive into the exciting world of detective games. Solve puzzles, crack codes, examine documents, combine evidence and facts, draw conclusions and solve the case!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Market Works
boardgame.description:
Learn how to make money in-game and in real life! The objective of the game is to use your money strategically and take advantage of investment opportunities to maximize your money so you can handle expenses, while also managing your debt. The game subconsciously teaches players a lot about finance so they become familiar with principle concepts.

The first person with $50,000 and no debt wins, if 2 people reach the goal during the same turn, the player with more money wins. You lose and are out of the game if you run out of money or can't pay back your debt (bankrupt); The last player standing wins. If you lose money, give it to the bank (ex. Someone plays a “Bear”); If you gain money, take it from the bank (ex. Someone plays a “Bull”)

Anytime during your turn, you can choose to invest however much money you own into the stock market. When you invest money, set it on the table face up, this money will be returned when the next yellow card is played (your investment is locked up until there is a Market card played)

To end your turn you must draw from the Action deck. You have the possibility of drawing a Market card, Action card, or Expense card. Market cards (yellow) determine the return on your investments. Action cards (blue) can be used to directly benefit you or sabotage opponents (ex. "Rob" allows you to steal an opponent's card). Expense cards (red) force you to pay the bank the specified sum on the card as soon as drawn. Expenses can only be paid with savings (money that isn't invested).

boardgame.name: DramaSystem SRD
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This document is made available by Robin D. Laws and Pelgrane Press in support of the DramaSystem open content arrangement.

It is not a teaching document structured to show you how to play and enjoy DramaSystem, but a reference document for writers and game designers to create their own products derived from DramaSystem.

User summary:

Two versions of the System Reference Document are available under different licensing agreements.

boardgame.name: The Party in a Box
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A 4-Hour adventure set in the Land of Sweet Nothings (the creator’s Feywild domain); Legal for D&D Adventurers League Forgotten Realms characters levels 1-4.

An elven woman, desperate for the return of her kidnapped daughter, coerces unsuspecting adventurers into a deceptive corner of the Feywild known as The Land of Sweet Nothings. In this, the second of the Sweet Nothings series, characters follow the trail of the lost girl to a group of satyrs willing to trade information for help opening a stubbornly locked box.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: ダイエットリテ (Dietrick-taking)
boardgame.description:
ダイエットリテ (Dietrick-taking) is a trick-taking game from Japan.

Your fat tummy, upper arms, and thighs have continued to advocate for a diet.
And finally, you decided to listen to that voice (great).
The player who finds the balance between diet and exercise and has the most successful diet will be the winner.

Trick-taking with a card with numbers 1-9 and 4 suits, the winner of trick raises 2 types of the gauges. The lowest player gives each player a hand of cards and replenishes his or her hand from the deck.

The player with the smallest difference between the numbers on the two gauges wins.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Ferret Games Factory (フェレットゲームズファクトリー)

boardgame.name: The Hunters A.D. 2114: Custom Dice
boardgame.description: Set of 5 custom dice.

boardgame.name: Cults & Covens: Cults
boardgame.description:
In this Cults & Covens game. Players take on the roles of Lovecraftian gods competing to grow the most influential cult. Villager cards from the play area can be taken as priests that can take actions and give their god influence over their families or cultists who can be drained for strength. Players must balance their need for initiative with their need for power and their need for influence over the 5 noble families.

—description from the publisher

Cults & Covens: Cults is one of three games included in Cults & Covens.

boardgame.name: Winter
boardgame.description:
Every winter, the lake freezes over. It won’t last long, so we have to play as soon as possible, trying to dominate the frozen parts of the lake before everything unfreezes and we lose everything. In order to win, choose key spaces wisely before your rival does, and control them. Show that the cold never bothered you.

In Winter, two players compete to be the player with the most chips of their color on the lake at the end of the game. The game is divided into two phases. In the first, the freezing phase, players will create the frozen lake in a contiguous form using their snowflake cards. They’ll also attempt to secure zones in which they’ve managed to group four snowflakes of their color using chips. In the second phase, the unfreezing, they’ll undo the creation by moving and retrieving their cards and chips of their color. At the end of the game, the player with the most chips on the table is declared the winner.

Winter is an abstract game for 2 players ages 8 and up. Games last 10 minutes in which good decisions are everything. This is a reissue of the 2016 edition with all new mechanics.

Winter was the winner of the 2021 Cardboard Edison Award. It’s the first of a series of the 4 Seasons series that will continue later with Autumn, Summer, and Spring.

boardgame.name: Agents of Adventure
boardgame.description:
Agents of Adventure is a one-player adventure card game set in a fantastical version of 1920s and 1930s earth.

Players lead a team of three heroes on a thrilling mission, their every move hindered by an evil mastermind and their dastardly minions.

Every round, your heroes roll a number of dice equal to their dice stat. Each dice can be spent to perform an action like attacking, resting, furthering your objective or performing one of the special actions on a hero card. The value of the dice represents the speed and power of the action. Low rolls can be spent on fast, weak actions. Higher rolls can be spent on slower, more powerful actions.

The game is won when all the objectives on the mission card have been completed. The game is lost when all three heroes are incapacitated or you run out of time.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Auf Vorposten
boardgame.description:
Auf Vorposten ("On the Outpost") is typical roll and move game about WWI. The first player, who cross the route with 60 stops first - wins the game.
There are two separate routes (Germans vs. French) with equal stops but with different pictures and stories about actual war in different side.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Stressful Rally
boardgame.description:
Created with the spirit of arcade gaming : you put a coin inside the machine, push the start button, play 5 minutes, lose, put another coin, play 5 minutes, lose again, you don't have coins anymore, you leave, it's fun. Play a hand-drawn rally game from behind the wheel with a top notch view !

With a simple accelerate/decelerate mecanism thanks to 3 dices, an ABS system which gives you a dice bonus, a damage system and up to 3 unique vehicles and 6 stages to choose from, this game is a good filler which can take a short time to play thanks to multiple modes like "Quick race" or "Championship".

Participated in the 2021 7th Roll & Write Contest on BGG as the first board game of Kikwik.

boardgame.name: Critical: Foundation – Season 1
boardgame.description:
It's 2035, and the world has changed a little. Huge multinationals have taken over, and nanotechnologies are part of everyday life. Icarus was created to respond to the new challenges that this new way of life brings. Its goal: Investigate sensitive cases and undertake delicate operations.

Critical: Foundation – Season 1 is constructed like a television series, with each of the nine episodes taking 30 minutes to play. You can take on the role of Gamemaster, who directs the adventure, or play as one of the characters to put yourself in the story. The game provides an RPG-style experience with board game scaffolding via character cards and dice-based combat.

boardgame.name: Borders: Europe
boardgame.description:
Grab your suitcase and lets explore Europe!

Borders: Europe is the game about discovering the countries of Europe and how they fit together.

As an owner of a set of Borders cards you and your family can play many different games. The main "Make the Map" game, players use the connections between countries to play out cards from their hand whilst building a map of Europe.

There are other games which kids can play solitaire or in groups, there are rules to balance games between different ages and skill levels, there are co-operative games and competitive games.

Through all the different game modes, players incidentally learn about the flags and countries of Europe, their connections, their capital cities and more.

boardgame.name: Cults & Covens
boardgame.description:
Cults & Covens includes 3 completely different games that are played with the same set of victim cards.

The victim deck contains 50 delicious victims from 5 powerful aristocratic families (10 each).

In each of these games, players play as monsters who are either eating these villagers or turning them into cultists, or vampire minions, or werecats, or drinking their blood. Players can play as vampires, werecats, or Lovecraftian gods and their associated cults. The 3 games play in the same environment and are fully compatible, allowing players to play vampires against gods, gods against cats, etc.

—description from the publisher

Cults & Covens is a boxed set, containing three games: Cults, Vampire, and Werecats.

boardgame.name: Stillfleet Quickstart Rules v2.0
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Stillfleet is a new tabletop RPG about exploring ruined spacecraft—hulks—and habitable earth-like planets, cut off from contact with Terra for decades or centuries—rocks.

Players take the roles of "voidminers"—explorers working for the Worshipful Company of Stillfleeters, more often known simply as the Co. Their home, the alien space station nicknamed Spindle—a sea slug made of undulating black stone, kilometers tall—is a mystery to its own inhabitants. It brims with timespace gates called stiffworks, many of which are already tacked to habitable worlds…

This Quickstart contains over forty pages of rules, aliens, settings, and random tables, as well as a separate document with nine Pregenerated Characters—different species and classes—and a blank character sheet (editable PDF).

boardgame.name: Gears of Industry
boardgame.description:
Gears of Industry is a Personalized Card Game (PCG) for 2-4 players. All players build their personalized decks from the same fixed card pool of two Tech Decks (52-cards). Each player customizes their own 26-card play deck to create a unique play experience to reflect their personality and play-style. Players also bring a customized 15-card Market deck contribution. Players combine their personalized Market deck contributions into a single communal Market deck. The theme of the game is an economic factory engine building game during the modern post-industrial era

Players play card(s) into markets. When the active player has three cards in a market that player can trigger a market clash (poker hand competition). They compete against other players by making poker hands to score points. The winners of the market clash scores victory points based on the rank of the poker hand they formed. The first to get to 7 victory points wins the game. Ties are broken with the value of a player’s factory and market cards.

GAME PLAY – Each player's personalized play deck will contain Technology cards (Gear cards) which represent factories. Factory cards allow other cards to be played into the two Markets. Horizontal (left or right-facing) Factory cards pay for playing Market cards. Upright and upside-down Factory cards can boost a market. Each market contains two neutral market cards. On their turn, the active player can use game effects on their Market cards or one of the neutral Market cards. The active player can trigger a Market Clash. During a Market Clash all the players compete in a Market by making the best poker hand they can using the player’s market cards, the two neutral market cards, and one factory card in the market boost orientation. The winners of the market clash scores victory points based on the rank of the poker hand they formed. Winning players score 1 victory point for a poker hand up to a three of a kind, or 2 points for higher ranked hands. Factory cards are rotated when Market cards are played and during the Market Clash step.

boardgame.name: On Base Baseball
boardgame.description:
On Base Baseball is a Sabermetric-driven tabletop baseball game using cards, charts, and dice. Using real MLB players gamers can recreate many modern and classic games and seasons. At its heart, On Base is a game engine that you can change and add to as you like. It is basic enough to be played quickly (similar to basic APBA or Strat-o-matic) but, through gamer mods, it can become more nuanced.

There are carded seasons for the game and there are whole decades of roster sheets available. The older cards have at bat outcomes right on the cards while newer card sets and roster sheets give you the values to use while playing the game but the outcomes are found on the game engine chart--the heart of the game.

Game play is based off of some of the original dice baseball games from the early 20th century--roll two d6 dice and a d9 (or d10). From that roll result the gamer cross references the player's game play values against the roll number to find the outcome of the at bat.

One of the unique features of the game is the pitcher/hitter interaction. Every at bat starts with the pitcher. If there is an outcome for the pitcher then the at bat is complete. If the outcome for the pitcher is blank then the outcome comes from the batter. The game is based on the DIPS Sabermetric theory so pitchers will affect strikeouts, walks, and home runs based on their ability to control those outcomes in real life.

boardgame.name: Dragonborne
boardgame.description:
Dragonborne is a solitaire fantasy wargame played with a narrative campaign. The player assumes the role of the titular Dragonborne: a person who is psychically bonded to an ancient biological war machine known as a Dragon. Together, the Dragon and rider confront a series of enemies human, mechanical and monstrous in tactical battles of resource and position management on their journey to fulfil their destiny.

This is a pure solitaire game. All enemy activity is regulated by an automata controlled by a single die roll per turn and answering a few questions. There are 29 different opponents included, each presenting their own strengths and weaknesses for the player to discover and overcome. Each battle is connected to the next by a story, and the player's resources are persistent from one fight to the next so thinking ahead is critical. Depending on the player's performance, they will end up playing one of three branching campaign paths, each with their own different opponents.

As the story progresses, the Dragon will evolve, gaining new powers and abilities randomly or as directed by the player along an evolutionary tree. There are 60 different evolutionary powers to choose from and combine, allowing for a huge range of strategies. You may end up with a massive, heavily-armoured Dragon able to absorb incoming attacks and retaliate using the attacker's own energy, a swift, nimble Dragon that outmaneuvers it's opponents before finishing them with precision attacks, an offensive powerhouse that rends it's enemies to pieces with jaw and tail, or a shamanistic monster that uses magic and the elements to overcome adversaries.

boardgame.name: Sa-Rê
boardgame.description:
Pharaoh is about to abdicate and give the reins of power to one of his children: the Sa-Re. To determine who will be the most able to rule Egypt among them, Pharaoh gives his children a mission: each of them should build a monumental city.

The most talented will receive the crown.

Each player has their own construction site, resources and workers, who need to be “incited” to work faster and better than the others. But beware of revolts that could paralyze your plans! Each turn, players can choose to push their workers beyond their limits to work more than necessary and accumulate resources to erect new buildings. These buildings will reward players with various advantages during the game.

Be the first one to erect a monumental city and rule over Egypt!

boardgame.name: Beast Clans
boardgame.description:
Beast Clans is a collectible trading card battle game, set in a post-apocalyptic world ruled by beasts.

Humans have vanished from Earth without a trace leaving only the animals to take their place. Over many years, they evolved becoming creatures able to fight. They created their own world of eight kingdoms: Ocean, Marsh, Jungle, Desert, Mountain, Savannah, Arctic, Outback and the Rebels.

boardgame.name: ロジカル真王 (Logical Thinking)
boardgame.description:
ロジカル真王 (Logical Thinking) is a two player deduction game from Japan. Designed by a manga artist and published by a manga publisher, the game is sold in their stores and has a manga produced with it.

The deck has cards numbered from 0 to 9, and each card has a special action on it. Each player chooses two cards and hides them from the other player, standing them up in small standees. The players must deduce which cards are hidden.

The players start with two hit points. Each time a player makes a correct deduction, and accurately identifies a hidden card (an attack), the hiding player loses a hit point. When a player gets to zero, or starts their turn with no hand cards, they lose the game. But players can recover points when playing cards during the game.

Each player has a hand of the remaining cards, and take turns playing a hand card and then making a guess. The hand card played has a special demand, such as, 'is this card a 5 or higher?', or 'which card has the higher value?'. Other cards have actions such as, return a played card to your hand, and, your opponent may not attack this turn. As cards are played out to the table, it becomes more obvious what cards are hidden.

However, when a hidden card is revealed, it goes back to the player's hand and they may place another card hidden.

By logical deduction, a player should be able to work out which cards are hidden and eliminate their opponent.
user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: コロコロコミック編集部 (Corocoro Comic Editorial Department)

boardgame.name: Arcs
boardgame.description:
In Arcs, 3-4 players guide their factions through a fast-playing space opera that unfolds over a trio of 60-90 minute sessions. The game opens in the final days of a decaying empire. Players take the role of the last regents of a once proud state that stretched to the farthest worlds of the Reach. Faced with an encroaching blight that threatens the outer planets, players must balance the integrity of their homelands with their own ambitions.

Arcs uses an innovative card-driven action system that is easy-to-learn and highly interactive. Players are given hands of action cards each turn and must balance their desire to control the game's tempo against their other interests. Should you use the initiative to seize control of a critical new technology or reposition your fleets for a coming engagement? When players do trade blows, the battles are resolved in a snap using a simple dice system. However, combat's interaction with the larger action system offers players a wide range of tactical options, from multi-turn sieges to daring raids and dramatic escapes.

Players begin the game in roughly symmetrical positions, which helps new players learn the core systems quickly. However, their choices will soon cause their paths to diverge. Unearthing an ancient technology might make the restoration of the empire possible. A chance discovery on a blighted world might lead a player to abandon their wealth and begin a voyage across the Reach to right an ancient wrong. Every choice will advance the game's story and form part of an emergent, player-driven campaign.

Many of these choices are resolved in a special "intermission" between games. During this phase, new rules modules are activated, and players are introduced to new capabilities and objectives. Despite their similar starting points, by the end of a campaign, players might control factions as varied as any in Root or Vast. Players will also use the intermission to spend their hard-earned power to maintain their fleets and wealth, as well as invest in new improvements that may aid them in the coming game.

The campaign system of Arcs provides players with a huge number of possible game situations and hundreds of possible campaigns. In addition, Arcs also includes an abridged, two-session campaign and a single session mode.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes:
New PREORDER arcs all in pledge
Final sale. KS delays are common

boardgame.name: Twin Stars: Adventure Series II – Oversized Scenario cards
boardgame.description:
A pack of all 6 scenario cards in a larger size (3.5" x 5.75" - 50% larger).

We made a set of large scenario cards. They don’t fit in the wallet, but they make a real nice table presence, and make everything just a touch bigger.

boardgame.name: Twin Stars: Adventure Series I – Oversized Scenario cards
boardgame.description:
A pack of all 6 scenario cards in a larger size (3.5" x 5.75" - 50% larger).

We made a set of large scenario cards. They don’t fit in the wallet, but they make a real nice table presence, and make everything just a touch bigger.

boardgame.name: Lost Echo
boardgame.description:
Lost Echo by indie gamedev KickBack is a modern, story driven, visually ambitious, intuitive, sci-fi mystery adventure game.

Publisher blurb

boardgame.name: Starlots
boardgame.description:
Starlots is four games in one played on a two-sided cloth board. The various games encourage both competition and teamwork. The big adventure game on the map side of the board works like a miniature Lightraider mission with snippets of adventure on every card. You’ll face trolls, goblins, flowing lava, portals, and much more. The movement racing games on the flip side develop strategy and focus. The fast-moving letter game builds a quick mind.

Box includes flippable playing board that supports two games on each side. All games are played in turns, round-robin style.
ZORPTFILTHUMPER is a letter jumble game with point values derived from which letters are used to make words.
ZigZag Dragon and Goblins at the Gate is a roll-and-move game where the board presents various obstacles.
Lightraider Adventure (standard mode) is a collaborative game using card drafting and dice to complete movement-based, team objectives.
Lightraider Adventure (enhanced mode) using an expansion First Watch card deck.

boardgame.name: First Watch
boardgame.description:
The shadows deepen around your campsite in the first watch of the night. An enemy appears. Rouse your companions!

In the First Watch box, you’ll find 85 verse cards suited by the Fruit of the Spirit. These are divided into a 50-card Lightraider deck and a 35-card Battle deck. You’ll also find rule cards plus a key card to help you use this deck with other Lightraiders games. The Battle deck includes the cards you need to score victories. These are verses used when battling allegorical enemies in the Lightraiders realm.

If you don’t remember the verse referenced on the battle card in play, use a lightraider card from your hand that matches its suit. Or recite a verse from a card in an opponent’s hand. Of course, you can only see the reference on the back of your opponent’s card, so you’ll have to rely on memory.

Lightraiders play this game on the road and at Lightraider Academy to practice sacred verses and prepare for battle. Now you can play First Watch at home. Even better, use your First Watch cards for organization and reference during other lightraider adventures. This set makes a great companion to the original DragonRaid Vintage Boxed Set or Starlots the Game. Game effects are listed on each card, and each card also incorporates a real-life Scripture application to expand your discipleship learning.

Intended as Bible memory verse tool that has been gamified to support an expanded/enhanced play method for DragonRaid and/or Starlots.

boardgame.name: Inked Starlots
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Hold each StarLot up to the light, looking through from point to point, and you will see a star in the middle.

User summary:

Each set includes one "StarLot" (die) of each color: Tanzanite, Saphire, Topaz, Ruby, Emerald, Fire Sunstone, and Diamond.

boardgame.name: Splito
boardgame.description:
Splito is a fun and fast card game for 3 to 8 players! Based on a draft principle, at each turn put a card between you and your neighbor on the left... or on the right! Help each other to complete the objectives but be the smartest to be the only one to win!

Each player receives 13 cards at the beginning of the game, and at the end of each turn, each player chooses a card (Objective or Value) from his hand and decides to place it between him and his neighbour on the left or right.

At the end of the 13 rounds, each player checks the Objectives in each zone between the players, and the two common Objectives, revealed at the beginning of the game, are also attributed to the zones that have fulfilled the conditions.The score of each player is calculated by multiplying the points obtained in the zone to his left by the points in the zone to his right.

The score of each player is calculated by multiplying the points obtained in the area on his left by the points in the area on his right. Throughout the game, it is therefore necessary to balance this double alliance in order to score as well as possible on both sides and emerge as the sole winner.

boardgame.name: Retribution (OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An OSR adventure for four 1st-level PCs by Creighton Broadhurst

This expanded, reorganised edition of Retribution features new art and new text.

In the frozen depths of winter, murderous winds mercilessly batter the crumbling Priory of Cymer. Within, trapped by their duty and the heaped snowdrifts that render travel near impossible, the few remaining faithful huddle together and tend the sacred places of their forbears. With the weather worsening, nerves fray and tempers snap as the wind howls its mournful dirge for the forgotten dead of a fallen time. But the worst is yet to come. One of those trapped within holds a murderous grudge that only blood can expunge and as the storm reaches its savage height terrible revenge is wrought amid the frigid halls and faded glories of a bygone age.

boardgame.name: Master of Wills: Official Game Mat
boardgame.description:
Product Specification
• Measures 19″ x 28 1/2″ x 1/8″
• Non slip bottom
• Sized for 112mm x 63mm.
• Stitched borders
• Great for travel.

boardgame.name: Harbingers of the Yawning Void
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Behold the Unmaking of All Things!

There are living beings in the world that desire the unmaking of all things. They would see the World Tree fall and burn, all it supports crumble to dust, and that dust blown into nonexistence upon the winds of the Void. These nihilistic creatures seek to be the harbingers of that great unmaking, gnawing at the foundations of the world to bring about its collapse.

They call themselves the Harbingers of the Yawning Void.

Demon Cults & Secret Societies: Harbingers of the Yawning Void for 5th Edition is a 20-page glimpse into this secretive group, and reveals many of the plots, goals, and methods of this void-bound cult. Discover their leaders, their minions and their magic for 5th Edition, including:

3 annihilation-bound NPCs such as the infiltrator, the Void-Bound Warlock, and the Witness, fully illustrated


Six new spells and magic items, including the Litany of Destruction, the ravager's ax, and the strange potion called the Wisp of the Void

A complete set of plots, schemes, and campaign elements from Level 1 to 15
Two new void monsters, the umbral shambler and the insatiable brood, fully detailed and illustrated


Challenge your players with a truly horrific cult of nihilists bent on destruction, with unique magic, leaders, and abilties to warp, curse and destroy matter--in the service of a great apocalypse.

boardgame.name: Microbes
boardgame.description:
Microbes is a simple family game that entertains both the youngest and the parents. The goal: to stay sick by guarding against large microbes or by catching those of others.

Players receive a microbe card (value 1-10) and three more are placed in front of the card shuffler (brewer). Starting with the player to the left of the brewer, the latter will secretly look at his card and may be able to keep it, or exchange with the next player. The exchange is automatically accepted, unless the player under a Atchoum! of value 10, which means that the exchange is refused and that both players must keep their original card. When the turn of the brewer comes, he can keep his card, or else, having no one left with whom to trade, replace it with one of the three in front of him.

When the round ends, the player(s) with the lowest value card loses the round and a box of tissues.

Microbes est un jeu familial simple qui amuse tant les plus jeunes que les parents.
Le but : rester malade en garde pour soi les gros microbes ou en attrapant ceux des autres.
Deroulement: Après avoir pris leurs jetons boîtes de mouchoirs, chaque joueur reçoit une carte microbe (d'une valeur de 1 à 10) et trois autres sont placés devant le brasseur de cartes. En commançant par le joueur à gauche du brasseur, celui-ci regardera secrètement sa carte et pourra être la conserver, soit l'échange avec le joueur suivant. L'échange est automatiquement accepté, sauf si le joueur sous une carte microbe Atchoum ! de valeur 10, ce qui fait en sorte que l'échange est refusé et que les deux joueurs doivent conserver leur carte d'origine. Quand vient le tour du brasseur, il peut être conservé sa carte, ou bien, n'ayant plus personne avec qui fait d'échange, la remplacer par l'une des trois qui se trouvent devant lui. Lorsque le tour se termine, le ou les joueur(s) avec la carte de la plus faible valeur perd la manche et une boîte de mouchoirs.

boardgame.name: Anomalous
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the sci-fi horror Savage Worlds setting Anomalous, agents of the mysterious Hearst Foundation investigate the strange, dangerous things that slip through the cracks of our reality.

These cosmic infections can take on many forms, such as:

A swamp in New Jersey where blinking eyeballs grow from trees

Pillars of frozen darkness that appear whenever a new Vaughn family member is born

A hand mirror that rapidly ages anyone who looks into it

The woman in Toronto who walks through walls, but melds with any flesh she touches

The Hearst Foundation is not alone. Shadowy rival organizations track down anomalies for their own secretive purposes. While the Foundation protects humanity from the dangers of the unknown, the others seek only the power that anomalies bring, and will stop at nothing to get it.

Anomalous includes rules for creating Foundation agents, a catalog of oddities to investigate, secret truths of the universe, and systems for generating your own world-infecting anomalies.

boardgame.name: Forces of Darkness: Zunirei of the Thousand Eyes (SW)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forces of Darkness – Zunirei of the Thousand Eyes presents a demon who isn’t interested in your player characters’ souls, or setting the universe on fire. Instead, her interests lie in discovering the best-hidden secrets of your campaign world and revealing them for all to see, spreading chaos and disorder through their revelation. No one – governments, priesthoods, celestial beings, or even other demons - is safe from her desire to reveal their deepest, darkest secrets. What secrets do your players have, and can they keep them safe from her Thousand Eyes?

Each volume of Forces of Darkness contains a detailed history of a NPC to help you understand how they came to be a threat worthy of your players’ characters, a discussion of their motivations to help you design plots for them to enact, notes on allies and henchmen they regularly employ, a discussion of their tactics to help you when your players start to push back against their machinations, and several story seeds to help get you started integrating them into your campaign. Each focal NPC is presented in a minimum of two fully developed stat blocks, one version at their default power level, and a second, Legendary version, to maximize their usefulness.

boardgame.name: Forces of Darkness: Zunirei of the Thousand Eyes (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forces of Darkness Zunirei of the Thousand Eyes Brings a New Evil to Your Pathfinder Game Night

Forces of Darkness Zunirei of the Thousand Eyes presents a demon who isn't interested in your player characters' souls, or setting the universe on fire. Instead, her interests lie in discovering the best-hidden secrets of your campaign world and revealing them for all to see, spreading chaos and disorder through their revelation.

No one -- governments, priesthoods, celestial beings, or even other demons -- is safe from her desire to reveal their deepest, darkest secrets. What secrets do your players have, and can they keep them safe from her Thousand Eyes?

boardgame.name: Reel 'Em In
boardgame.description:
In Reel 'Em In, one player takes on the role of a fisherman, and two or more players take on the role of fish. Fish players compete to get the most points, while the fisherman tries to catch one of the fish to steal their points.

While fish gain points by snatching up food cards, the fisherman steals points from the fish. Fish Players take turns selecting Fruit cards, which give them points!
Hidden among the food cards is a hook placed by the Fisherman, and when a fish picks it up the Fish and Fisher compete! Each shouts their Powerphrase, and the first to finish their word wins.
This results in either the Fisherman stealing all of the fish's points, or the fish swimming away. The fisherman benefits more when the fish has lots of points, so must place their hook down strategically.

The game ends when there are no more fruit cards left in the deck. The player with the most points wins!

boardgame.name: Burger Bear Bonanza
boardgame.description:
The Burger Bear Bonanza! Game from Mudpuppy is a fun new game to see who can really stack up!

Players can match, stack & steal toppings to build burger bears! Whoever completes 2 burger bears wins and is the bear to beat!

boardgame.name: Master of Wills: Waterborne Fringe War Neutral Pack
boardgame.description:
A group of nomadic sea travellers were forced to inhabit two islands in the cold and distant northern hemisphere centuries ago. These rugged people somehow survived the tidal apocalypse when a comet damaged the planet’s moon however, dust-like particles from the comet penetrated the atmosphere effecting only their small area of the world.

12 New Cards + 1 Holo Card

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Master of Wills: Waterborne Expansion Faction Deck

boardgame.name: The Knight Line (Issue 4)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this issue The Knight Line shows a former corporation that can still be used in Dark Times. Offers a new DNA Strand from Gryphon Bio-Chemical and introduces a Hybrid Mutant/Enhanced. Also in this issue, NPC Profile that can be used for Wicked Pacts along with Plot seeds. Supply and Demand a Dark Times Adventure written by Mickey Barfield and a fantasy story with plot seeds that is system agnostic.

boardgame.name: Zilionaires Road Trip USA
boardgame.description:
Bid, bluff and buy up America’s legendary roadside real estate! As one of the five richest people in history, you already own all the big stuff in America. We’re talking the Golden Gate Bridge, Mount Rushmore, The Chrysler Building…you’ve got ‘em all.

It’s now time to aim your insanely big wallets at 49 of America’s legendary roadside attractions.

To get your hands on these beauties you’ll need to outbid and out-bluff your zillionaire rivals.

You start the game with 49 zillion dollars (and can earn more on payday), but your money will soon run as dry as Death Valley if you get involved in a bidding war — so bid smart.

boardgame.name: Shoot for the Stars
boardgame.description:
Think you can guess how many floors are in the Empire State Building?

In Shoot for the Stars, you don’t need to know the exact answer to win coins. You just need to shout out a number that gets close... without going over.

Whenever someone gives an answer, you have to decide whether you’ll guess higher, stick along for the ride or abandon ship. Guess too high and you win nothing, but make the right call and you’ll blast off with all the coins.

boardgame.name: Sounds Fishy
boardgame.description:
Sounds Fishy isn't about always knowing the right answer — it's about being able to spot the fake ones. It's like a mix between The Chameleon and Balderdash.

Sounds Fishy is the party game full of strange questions and even stranger answers.

Pick up points by eliminating the fake answers that have been invented by the other players — but be careful! One of them has given you the real answer. Accidentally choose it and you’ll lose all your points and your turn.

Think you can tell which answers sound fishy? You’ll need to think on your feet, get creative and push your luck to win the game where everyone has an answer for you.

boardgame.name: Blockbuster Trilogy Box Set
boardgame.description:
Three great movie games in one big VHS. Each one is like a round of Movie Charades mixed with Family Fortunes.

Lord of the Rings. Back to the Future. The Godfather. There’s been some great trilogies over the years — but this one’s a real show-stopper.

Introducing the Blockbuster Box Set. Three dynamite party games about the movies you know and love, all wrapped up in one giant VHS bundle. Play them one at a time or combine all three games together for a big-budget, Blockbuster-style showdown. All you’ll need to bring are the players... and a decent amount of popcorn.

boardgame.name: Chicken Vs Hotdog
boardgame.description:
Okay, it’s time to settle this once and for all – who is top dog (or chicken)? Get ready to find out.

Split into teams, or go one-on-one, then grab your Sling’Em® and get ready to bid and flip your way to sweet-tastin’ victory.

Turn over a Challenge Card, then secretly bid high if you think you can nail it or bid low to avoid it. If both bids match, then it’s Flipperama time!

Every time you complete a challenge, you’ll get to turn over one of your Character Cards. The first player to turn over all six, wins the game!

boardgame.name: Pirater! (1.5)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Enorma rikedomar byter ägare i världens hamnar. Handeln blomstrar och Europas kolonialmakter blir ständigt rikare. Samtidigt kryssar pirater och kapare runt på de sju haven i sina försök att roffa åt sig en del av dessa skatter.

Här ställs rollpersonerna inför havens alla faror, gömda guldskatter, skrupellösa piratjägare och giriga köpmän. Hjältedåd och äventyr är vardagsmat. Men är du redo för detta? Tag då ditt skepp, din besättning och dina närmaste mannar och ge dig ut på världshaven i jakt på rov.

Pirater! är ett historiskt matinérollspel med mytiska inslag. Perioden är 1650-1750. Spelet fokuserar främst på action, pirater och mystik.

Innehåll
Regelboken innehåller all information som behövs för att spela. Detta inkluderar bland annat:

Informativa och stämningsskapande texter om tidens pirater och deras viktigaste fästen.
Ett snabbt mallbaserat system för att skapa rollpersoner.
Konfliktsystem anpassat för de situationer som kan dyka upp i äventyr under piraternas tidevarv. Strider blir snabba och händelserika där de behöver och såväl fysiska som verbala attacker har förmågan att dräpa.
System som stödjer och uppmuntrar galna stunts, fartfylld action och strid med stora mängder hantlangare.
Ett långt kapitel om det övernaturliga, med regler för att skapa egna monster och sagoväsen.
Regler för skepp och sjöstrid. Har du alltid drömt om att styra ditt eget skepp? Nu har du chansen!
Förslag på äventyr, plus en äventyrsgenerator som inspirationskälla.
Ett spännande äventyr med vandöda pirater, en förbannad ö, och otrevliga sjörövare.
Utöver denna bok behöver du endast penna, medspelare samt en 20-sidig tärning.

Regler
Spelsystemet kan sammanfattas med att man slår 20-sidiga tärningar när man vill lyckas med något. Under eller lika med chansen att lyckas ger ett framgångsrikt slag. Ju högre tärningsresultatet sedan är desto bättre är det.

Systemet är i grunden ganska traditionellt och liknar BRP, men har en hel del inslag av modernt systemtänk. En rollperson har åtta egenskaper och ett antal färdigheter. Drivkrafter och egendefinierade expertiser påverkar sedan chansen att lyckas med olika saker. För att dra ned på antalet tärningsslag kombineras ofta olika färdighetsslag ihop till ett enda. Den som kombinerar tillräckligt mycket får lättare att lyckas.

För att få lite fart och fläkt finns dels en färdighet för omöjliga stunts och dels så kallade matinépoäng. De senare kan användas till allt ifrån att göra rollpersonen bättre till att ändra lite på omgivningen eller tärningsslag.

Konfliktsystemet är snabbt och smidigt. Det är utvecklat för att ge en känsla av fart och fläkt. För att främja detta finns till och med olika typer av fiender, allt ifrån mäktiga huvudaktörer till så kallade hantlangare. De senare är dussinmotståndare som är mycket lätta att besegra i drivor, allt för att ge rätt matinékänsla. I och med att förolämpningar och attacker ämnade att trycka ned motståndaren i skorna är helt i linje med piratgenren är det fullt möjligt att utföra sociala attacker som skadar mentalt. Detta sköts helt och hållet som vanliga fysiska attacker. Det är dessutom möjligt att utkämpa helt sociala strider, vilket sköts på samma sätt som fysiska.

Som en bonus medföljer regler för sjöslag och skepp. Ett skepp hanteras på ungefär samma sätt som en rollperson. Det har egenskaper, expertiser och till och med speciella uppgraderingar. Sjöslagssystemet är gjort för att vara taktiskt samtidigt som det inte är för detaljerat. Så bara bygg ditt eget skepp, rekrytera en besättning och segla ut på de sju haven.

Versionsskillnader
Version 1 skapades för att vara ett kom-igång-snabbt-spel kopplat till En Garde! III. Spelet har allt som behövs för att spela, men saknar ett komplett äventyr. Version 1.5 som kom några år senare innehåller en del extramaterial jämfört med Pirater! 1, nämligen ett helt nytt äventyr, hela Väsen-boken, ett uppdaterat Skeppskapitel, världsinformation som kopplar ihop spelvärlden med den i Skuggornas mästare och Privateers!, samt lite småfixar.

Övrig information
Pirater! är gjordes från början för att ge pirat-fans ett lite mer lättsmält spel och första utgåvan finns att ta hem gratis. Denna version är helt kompatibel med version 1.5 och En Garde! III.

Version 1.5 trycktes först i 20 exemplar och såldes på GothCon 2018. Största delen av vinsten gick till Bröstcancerfonden (sammanlagt 1321 kronor). Den har sedan dess tryckts upp igen i ett fåtal exemplar för att säljas på nätet och på CalCon under några få dagar. Dessa är nu slut och denna utgåva kommer sedan aldrig att säljas i fysisk form igen. PDF-versionen finns dock till försäljning här och på MylingSpels hemsida.

boardgame.name: Yea o Nay
boardgame.description:
Yea o Nay is a simple but very competitive game.

90 cards divided into 5 categories of math questions/ IQ statements/ patterns observations/ quantities and colours.
Each card features a simple conundrum and each player have to be the first to guess/ estimate/ work out or remember if the card on the table is true or not ie yea o Nay.
If the answer is yea – be the first to put down a green card and a red card if the answer is Nay.
Now with a new card on the table, the process repeats and so on.

Whoever is the first to get rid of all his cards is the winner.

boardgame.name: Chronopia (Third edition)
boardgame.description:
It is a dark time. The Old Gods have deserted the world. A new dark pantheon of Gods watches over the earth and feeds upon the spoils of war; a banquet of souls slain on the wretched battlefields of Chronopia.

Chronopia is a 32mm-Skirmish-Fantasy-System. In principle there are two kinds of strategy plays: Skirmish or Massive Battles. First turns around smaller engagements in loose formation, the other tells large mass battles. Chronopia has alternating activation of the units, different actions, basing on d20´s and the general simplicity and an nice playing speed. All this was formed into an extremely flexible and innovative game.
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Chronopia: War in the Eternal Realm

boardgame.name: フェアリーズアームス
妖精の施し (Fairy's Alms)
boardgame.description:
妖精の施し (Fairy's Alms) (フェアリーズアームス) is a co-operative game from Japan. Players are working together to get the two characters Rū (ルー) and Kū (クー) (a cat-girl and a rabbit-girl). The two friends are 'dream world dwellers', and the aim is to make all their dreams come true together with them.

Each player gets a character to help the friends, and some numbered cards they keep secret. The player lays their cards face-down in front of them, from lowest to highest, with the negative numbers to the left, and the positive to the right of their character. In tis way, players give an idea to each other what cards they might hold.

The dream world is a set of Dream cards laid out face-down in the middle of the table. The cards are staggered from one to four and back to one. The players must guide the two friends Rū and Kū on a path through these dreams, but they only win if they can complete all seven steps.

Each time a Dream card is turned up, the players decide which number card they will contribute. They have to combine their cards to add exactly to the one of the numbers on the Dream card. So if the Dream card has a number 1, players can use a +5, -3, -4 and +3 to get a total of 1. Players can discuss what they might offer, but not the exact values of their cards.

If the players fail to satisfy one Dream card, the game is lost.
user summary

boardgame.name: Dinositters!
boardgame.description:
Dinositters! is an entry weight worker placement puzzle game in which players take on the role of two teenage dino-siblings competing against the other families to keep the newly hatched babies fed and entertained until your parents return.

Each turn, players will place or move one of their siblings to gather resources or add hatchlings from the nursery to their nest. Players earn happiness by feeding hatchlings their favorite foods, finding friends for them to play with, and completing lava goals. Whenever a player adds their ninth hatchling, a lava space is empty, or three nursery spaces are empty, every other player gets one last turn before adding up final scores. The family with the most happiness wins!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Vagante
boardgame.description:
Venture into the world of Vagante, an action-rpg adventure that features permanent death and procedurally generated levels.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Tabletop Kingdom RPG
boardgame.description: Tabletop Kingdom RPG is a printable solo fantasy RPG wherein the player takes the role of a ruler of a magical kingdom. It is played with the rules/character sheet, a pencil, and a six-sided die.

boardgame.name: The Devil's Inheritance RPG
boardgame.description: The Devil's Inheritance RPG is a printable solo black magic RPG wherein the player takes the role of a sibling in an evil family trying to survive a diabolical curse from The Devil. It is played with the rules/character sheet, a pencil, and a deck of poker cards.

boardgame.name: The Isle Of Sorrow RPG
boardgame.description: The Isle Of Sorrow RPG is a printable solo fantasy RPG wherein the player takes the role of an adventurer journeying to a mystical isle to make a name for themselves. It is played with the rules/character sheet, a pencil, two six-sided dice, and a deck of poker cards.

boardgame.name: The Lost Spellbook RPG
boardgame.description: The Lost Spellbook RPG is a printable solo fantasy RPG wherein the player takes the role of a magician searching the land to retrieve pages of a lost book of spells. It is played with the rules/character sheet, a pencil, and a deck of poker cards.

boardgame.name: The Psychic Realm RPG
boardgame.description: The Psychic Realm RPG is a printable solo RPG wherein the player takes the role of a psychic trying to ascend to a higher mental state by exploring the realm of the mind. It is played with the rules/character sheet, a pencil, two six-sided dice, and a deck of poker cards.

boardgame.name: The Wild Weird West RPG
boardgame.description: The Wild Weird West RPG is a printable solo supernatural western RPG wherein the player takes the role of a gunfighter in a wild west of weird magic. It is played with the rules/character sheet, a pencil, and two six-sided dice.

boardgame.name: Nocturion: Deluxe Token Pack
boardgame.description:
Contains:
10x Sword (Metal)
10x Crystal Ball (Resin)
10x Wooden Log (Resin, Pre-painted)
10x Stone (Resin, Pre-painted)
10x Bow (Plastic)
Chalice (Metal)
Crown (Metal)
Hammer (Metal)

boardgame.name: Heroes of Normandie: War Stories – Hell's Fury
boardgame.description:
American troops are advancing into Germany. The beast is wounded but still dangerous. After many adventures, Wardaddy's Sherman runs over a mine and is immobilized at a crossroads. The radio broke down and has to be repaired as soon as possible. But young Norman, out on a reconnaissance mission, returns with grim news. An SS battalion is heading straight for their tank. Wardaddy convinces his men to stay and resist. They will hold to the last!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Heroes System Tactical Scale World War 2
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Heroes of Normandie: Big Red One Edition

boardgame.name: Dice Theme Park: Deluxe Add-ons
boardgame.description:

Included in this box are 3D monorails miniatures and the inserts for each player count, the innovations mini-expansion which adds new customisation options to your park, and the surprises mini-expansion which adds exciting new attraction tiles and staff skills with new mechanics.

—description from the back of the box
